meanings.definition: Press or squeeze (something) with force until it is flat or small.
meanings.sent1: She squashed the bug with her shoe.
meanings.sent2: The chef squashed the garlic cloves with a knife.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally squashed his sandwich in his backpack.
meanings.sent4: The heavy box squashed the delicate flowers underneath.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler squashed his opponent in the ring.

meanings.definition: Crush or squeeze (something) with force so that it becomes flat, soft, or out of shape.
meanings.sent1: The child squashed the playdough into different shapes.
meanings.sent2: The hiker accidentally squashed the berries in his backpack.
meanings.sent3: She squashed the stress ball to relieve tension.
meanings.sent4: The car squashed the empty soda can on the road.
meanings.sent5: The baker squashed the dough to make it flat for the pie crust.

meanings.definition: To be pressed or squeezed with force until flat or small.
meanings.sent1: The balloon squashed against the wall.
meanings.sent2: The sandwich squashed in the lunchbox.
meanings.sent3: The pillow squashed when he sat on it.
meanings.sent4: The cake squashed a bit when the icing was applied.
meanings.sent5: The toy squashed under the weight of the books on the shelf.
